intro: Andersonia spirophylla, commonly known as the spiral-flowered Andersonia, is a flowering plant native to the wet tropics of Queensland, Australia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant is characterized by its unique spiral arrangement of petals, which gives it its common name. It typically grows in dense rainforest understorey, preferring moist and shaded environments. Andersonia spirophylla is noted for its striking, fragrant flowers that bloom in spring and early summer.
